alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Berkeley; Charleston; Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 8:15AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Berkeley, Charleston, Colleton, Dorchester and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 814 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated widespread moderate to locally heavy rainfall expanding over much of Southeast South Carolina as strong nor`easter approaches. The risk for flooding will steadily increase this morning as high tide approaches. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Summerville, Hilton Head Island, Goose Creek, Hanahan, Bluffton, Beaufort, Port Royal, Moncks Corner, Walterboro, Tybee Island, McClellanville, Edisto Beach, Johns Island, West Ashley, Givhans Ferry State Park, Ladson, I-26/I-526 Interchange and Downtown Charleston.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. A Flash Flood Warning may be needed for some areas closer to high tide. Be prepared to take action should a warning be issued.
